alert.note: Alert for Dewey; Stanley; Sully (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 6:02PM MDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Sully, northwestern Stanley and southeastern Dewey Counties through 730 PM CDT/630 PM MDT/... At 702 PM CDT/602 PM MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over southwestern Lake Oahe, or 23 miles southeast of Eagle Butte, moving north at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of west central Sully, northwestern Stanley and southeastern Dewey Counties, including the following locations... eastern Cheyenne River Reservation. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
